Package chess.model.player

Class Player

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.player.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Agent, HumanPlayer
public abstract sealed class Player extends Colored permits Agent, HumanPlayer
An abstract class that represents a player in a Chess game.

There are only two types of player that directly extend this class:

  1. Agent: A smart agent (intelligence);
    All smart agents must extend Agent and implement required methods.
  2. HumanPlayer: A real human player connected via a user interface.
    Currently, HumanPlayer cannot be extended.
In a game, ChessGame queries the current player for a move and the player is responsible for deciding a move during their turn based on the current state of the game (more specifically, the state of the chessboard), which will be provided by ChessGame.

Note: All permitted subtypes of Player must implement the designated constructor: 

 Player(String name, Color color, int score)
Only constructors with the exact same type erasure would suffice, otherwise the player will not be loaded.
See Also:
  • Agent
  • HumanPlayer

  • Method Details

    • decode

      public static Player decode(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)
      Constructs an appropriate concrete subtype of Player from a JSON object containing the following required key-value mappings: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     "class":"<type>",
     "name":"<name>",
     "score":<score>,
     ...
 }
      where:
      • <type>: the class name of the player returned from this.getClass().getName();
      • <name>: the name of the player;
      • <score>: an integer number of the player's current score.
      Note: Subtypes of Player may require additional key-value mappings.
      Parameters:
      jsonObject - The source JSONObject from which to decode.
      Returns:
      An instance of Player decoded from the given JSON source.
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - If any of the required keys is missing or maps to an invalid value type.
      FormatException - Rethrown from Color.of(String) or dynamically from the constructors, or if <type> is invalid.
      NullPointerException - If jsonObject is null.
      See Also:
      • encode()

    • encode

      public org.json.JSONObject encode()
      Serializes this Player to a JSON object of the following format: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     "class":"<type>",
     "name":"<name>",
     "score":<score>,
     ...
 }
      where:
      • <type>: the class name of the player returned from this.getClass().getName();
      • <name>: the name of the player;
      • <score>: an integer number of the player's current score.
      Specified by:
      encode in interface chess.persistence.Codable
      Overrides:
      encode in class Colored
      Returns:
      A serialized object ready to be written.
      See Also:
      • Colored.encode()
